text: but I'm able to fetch data of my own themes

Something like the following should work:
```{% module 'header_logo'
  path='@HubSpot/logo',
  img={
    'alt': 'Company logo',
    'height': '82',
    'src': get_asset_url('../../images/image.png'),
    'width': '205'
  }
%}```

<@UEC65BQV8> out of curiosity, are you wanting to watch files to be uploaded to file manager becasse you are changing them often, or it just would be nice that when you add a file to a watched folder it just automatically gets uploaded, rather than needing to re-upload

We don't change them _too_ often, but many times we are creating new graphics for the marketing team to use on landing pages, etc, and its super convenient to just export them from photoshop in a src/img folder, and then a script runs in the background to optimize them and dump them into a dist/img folder which then automatically gets uploaded to the FM, ready to use for marketers. And sometimes we do need to make changes to the artwork, so being able to quickly upload the new version which overwrites the old is super helpful

when I was using the ftp route, it wasn't really working to try and upload only changed files in the entire asset/dist because trying to find the most recent version between local and the FM was wonky. Tried a bunch of timestamp adjustments, but in the end it would try and upload everything. So my work around was just to make a temp asset folder, export the optimized assets into there, then scrub it clean everytime. That way only changed or new files were uploaded to the FM

Hey, dummy question, do we have any kind of local environment to work with templates on my favorite IDE?
maybe some NPM server, Docker-container maybe some github example?

Hey Alex, check out <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started>

It gets you started with the <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli|CMS CLI> for local development and how you can scaffold out a theme based on our boilerplate theme: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate>
Hi can anyone let me know how to connect two HubSpot portals in single local environment
